jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

AC51B3B041534A51BE2DD3028469CD0E.description: CSIS5: Recite prayers and poems of substance that encourage all to strive for virtue and goodness.

6EE9B71EC97F4EF1A5E88B3670AB3B00.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group
discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See Grade 4 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

CCF72AA368C74D8598EA94456BBC0625.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

BD3D13C820C1478793ADD519260EEEF7.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support
main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

CBC466717972489C9FE84A21CB53FF1A.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

099779E3114C4F6C92C63F785E413C81.description: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

00ED3ABE6FF348FBB39C31394FB9EECF.description: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

FE47DD80AC664DC7BC4F7528C9420E11.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the
remarks of others in a respectful manner.

C89C0CC0BECB4A7EAD4D33C3DED6A8A2.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

95DD574620024ED3BDCD55240EDCE241.description:
Prepare for discussions (having read or studied required material); explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the
topic to explore ideas under discussion.

C0D5C078D16540F29D861DA34889865C.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led), building on others’ ideas and expressing their own
clearly

9960B79B8D7B429C80BDDBA297C703DC.description: Share the beauty and cadence of poetry for its impact on human sensibilities and formation of the soul. CSDS9

0F46F5C745A34DEE86F2BED379830919.description: Delight and wonder through reading aloud or listening to creative, sound, and healthy stories, and poems and plays. CSDS7

C0B0391701F845DE90AB172109D534C3.description: Share beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

EE86E461D89F4DFC93F14681C69B48A0.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

3216876D6EDA444CBD6DD771D13DC264.description: Listen attentively and display appropriate reverence during prayer time and in Church.

2BD77B17FA7C406FA8159C13F998A5B0.description: Catholic Standards for Speaking and Listening

BAD51848D44440A9A985AC2495928A12.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions,
emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when
discussing animal preservation).

4DAFA7452C004A64A96B8664FCC1EF57.description: Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

EA61384A1735469E82F5076F8EC02407.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

AC5946653F3143C5A33DB9AABB6B2897.description: Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

5503BC05578C424E9636064BFEB1F7D5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

BA9F0E4E4EFF4DC194C179BC3E7AE368.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key words and phrases.

7AF9931484324A5FBCD5514CF1DCA3D7.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

0A3962EAE39C4B00A6D8190C2EF6937E.description: Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

4AF6A866EC3B44848AA0CE38BBCE0BB4.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

D29509CC1B264AD28CE0942108D3122F.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., smallgroup
discussion).

9E792A9E746041AEAD44F38F8263726D.description: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.

04D8FC3E5E054E909F32C90059E154A7.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

EFB110E5E78C4C39B796E95B51D39717.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

8AC563ED74BF476D90FC02F607E8C9C1.description: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

0D314DE4E57A4C7DA62CA842254E811B.description: Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

254061906F424BACB26DD1164335137C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

49E52181C7304A89BB1E32E121A993B1.description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).

7FCDBD46E9034B138F6098EF3CC96FAB.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

E631792293ED44D3B817F590C5EAD774.description: Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).

059C3F61B7F44DA497F96CF4DD757805.description: Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

20998518BEA247A3AB527D72A20BB888.description: Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.

7DF991E65EFD40AD815E387AA6E2890D.description: Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).

7BF46B14693A4B3A8D0B96112459A1BE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

54B50CA1C14D4FFEA023ED4681D3C515.description: Use language to order our thoughts and to accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

F879C920E24A49A9A8D5401C41971491.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

81370CC71B5449BAA80ECB09230B8868.description: Exhibit an understanding that words are important to the Word

1D1893ECC664496A8995496B0262DE1E.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

AAD616A6B61D4EC1951FB38179F2A01A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

B6B74B9387A24DB7A13850A90505C104.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and
provide a list of sources.

17AE2F4341484105A1321854EE6C3444.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

ABDC161D659B4750A7E074C319306FDA.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BD0D31F345E94F558EE039C5DA71113D.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate
with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

9B27FFDE6C4346FFA7B8E236C300B97A.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

83103F18ADA2499DB0D419A0053F89B6.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience (include prayers and
meditations).

1FFFC587F664407EB31B3BACCB43696A.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

7926CEAD0C4F4ED6921A8466F5B38E06.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

223A4F2EB50A4930A964F56B87EED550.description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

165BE38B42694664BDF44D03070C421B.description: Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

4E73AB7F694F41BBB27BB20952DE44CB.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

0D7506A62BA94BE6866274F5E84BC824.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

05ADC37C05C3472C8EC342B854F12012.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

EBBCE6A472794E599C102B1DB2771EB0.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

55EF4C100DC64802B2475773600D6245.description: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

9BA0404706D54A149F9EC8BDFFB578EF.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

5F3D4205206D45EE91D717F69AB3BFF3.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia
when useful to aiding comprehension.

B0813E7310BA40A6AF4BC2035C439795.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic (including but not limited to a Catholic/religious topics) and convey ideas and information clearly.

D92DAAECCBFB4D809194408DDFE0ECBE.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

37499D6D53C54DFD9C8391DAFAB1B464.description: Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

A7085B4B1E1745DFB35704EFFDFB27BA.description: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

AAEB5ABD720D410E8C03682F8432D3C0.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer’s
purpose.

2FC6620B26C648D1B96A5D4EE823C2B8.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts (including but not limited to a Catholic/religious topics), supporting a point of view with reasons and information.

CE2D0A82606B410CAD9731D9DFCF931F.description: CSIS14: Write to explore reasoning and intent

3FB461D8117C42DD94DA5BDDA1B68B0F.description: CSIS8: Write to develop personal judgment based on truth, goodness and virtue.

0CDD9CF0524E403CAFECD539CA81625F.description: CSIS2: Write how spiritual knowledge and truth are represented and communicated through fairy tales, fables, myths, parables, and stories.

2CC6BA1655F24878902A1D28B7BF5648.description: Write in ways to order our thoughts, align them with truth, and accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

5658D6F354B04C3E97CA0317604C6968.description: Share well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

4C39182ADA69492299660575FB8C83D7.description: Create written works that glorify the Creator, reflect the heart of the Redeemer and are inspired by the Spirit.
